titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Liphold family scrapbook 1994.010
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-22T10:34-0500

did.abstract: This accession consists of one scrapbook belonging to the Liphold family dated circa 1920-1940. The scrapbook contains mostly newspaper clippings and programs and invitations to events such as weddings, parties, and charity events. Most items in the scrapbook concern members of the Liphold family of Brooklyn, as well as other families in Brooklyn and Pennsylvania.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Liphold family scrapbook, 1994.010, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The scrapbook was formally accessioned in 1994.
